macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stock Futures Rise Ahead of Holiday-Shortened Week
items.summary: Dow Jones futures up 80 points (0.2%), S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 futures advanced late Sunday as investors hope for a Santa Claus rally. Markets close early Wednesday for Christmas Eve and fully Thursday.

items.title: Wall Street Ends Week Higher Led by Tech Stocks
items.summary: S&P 500 rose 0.9% to 6,834.50 on Friday, up 0.1% for the week; Nasdaq gained 1.3% to 23,307.62, up 0.5%; Dow up 0.4% to 48,134.89. Tech sector rallied 2%, boosting indices amid holiday positioning.

items.title: U.S. CPI Surprise Fuels Market Optimism Despite Flat Retail Sales
items.summary: U.S. CPI at 2.7% annualized, below 3.1% expected, easing inflation fears; retail sales flat, signaling slowing economy. Fed rate cut expectations steady at two 0.25% cuts in 2026.

items.title: Bank of England Cuts Rates as Expected
items.summary: BoE delivered 0.25% rate cut with no surprises. Canadian CPI rose 0.1% month-on-month as anticipated.

items.title: S&P 500 Nears Record High After Weekly Gain
items.summary: S&P 500 ended Friday at 6,834.50, up slightly for the week and close to record high, driven by lower-than-expected inflation data despite prior declines.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surpasses $89,000 USDT with 0.79% 24-Hour Gain
items.summary: Bitcoin crossed the 89,000 USDT mark, trading at 89,005.953125 USDT as of December 22, 2025, 00:10 AM UTC, reflecting a modest 0.79% increase over the past 24 hours amid ongoing market fluctuations.

items.title: Bitcoin Long-Term Holder Profits Hit 20-Month Low, Increasing Selling Pressure
items.summary: Long-term Bitcoin holders' supply change dropped to a 20-month low, signaling elevated distribution as unrealized profits shrink, with BTC trading near $87,900 and facing resistance at $88,210.

items.title: XRP Price Stagnant at $1.90 Despite $1.2B ETF Inflows and Whale Accumulation
items.summary: Spot XRP ETFs surpassed $1.2 billion in assets with consistent inflows, while whale holdings (100M-1B XRP) rose to 12.8%, yet price remains flat near $1.90 due to muted momentum indicators.

items.title: Experts Warn Bitcoin Could Crash Below $50K by 2028 Without Quantum Resistance
items.summary: Industry leaders like Jameson Lopp and Charles Edwards highlight the urgent need for quantum-safe upgrades to Bitcoin's cryptography, warning of a potential preemptive price collapse if the network fails to adapt within 5-10 years.

items.title: Galaxy Digital Forecasts Uncertain Bitcoin Outlook for 2026, $250K Target by 2027
items.summary: Galaxy Digital's head of research Alex Thorn cites options signals and macro risks as reasons for Bitcoin's unclear 2026 path, while upholding a $250,000 price target by end of 2027.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Samsung Announces AI Vision Upgrade with Google Gemini for CES 2026
items.summary: Samsung will unveil an enhanced AI Vision feature for its Bespoke AI Refrigerator Family Hub at CES 2026, integrating Google Gemini for improved food recognition, including more fresh and processed foods without registration and user-labeled items.

items.title: NVIDIA Releases Nemotron 3 Family of Open Models
items.summary: NVIDIA announced the Nemotron 3 family of open models, data, and libraries, highlighted in real-time analytics news for the week ending December 20.

items.title: Edge Impulse Guest-Edits Elektor Issue on Edge AI
items.summary: Edge Impulse has guest-edited a special issue of Elektor magazine diving into edge AI, covering key terms for understanding edge AI and machine learning.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump's Tech and Media Umbrella Merges with Fusion Reactor Developer in $6B Deal
items.summary: President Trump's tech and media umbrella company is merging with a fusion reactor developer in a deal valued over $6 billion. The merger aims to advance fusion energy technology amid growing interest in clean power sources.

items.title: Waymo Autonomous Vehicles Freeze and Block Traffic During San Francisco Power Outage
items.summary: Waymo's self-driving cars halted operations and blocked traffic in San Francisco during a power outage, affecting service across at least seven cities in the Bay Area. The incident highlights vulnerabilities in robotaxi reliability during infrastructure failures.

items.title: Georgia Regulators Approve 50% Power Capacity Boost for Anticipated Data Center Demand
items.summary: Georgia regulators have approved a significant increase in power capacity, betting on future data center growth despite risks if demand projections fail. The decision addresses surging needs from tech infrastructure expansions.

items.title: Chinese Startup Launches Ghana TPU Chip Claiming Superiority Over Nvidia A100
items.summary: Zhonghao Xinying, founded by a former Google TPU engineer, unveiled the Ghana AI chip, which is reportedly 1.5x faster and 75% more efficient than Nvidia's A100 despite using an older process. The development signals China's push in custom AI hardware to reduce reliance on Nvidia.

items.title: Elon Musk's Fortune Grows by $55 Billion After Delaware Court Reinstates Tesla Pay Package
items.summary: A Delaware court awarded Elon Musk his $55 billion Tesla compensation package, boosting his net worth to $679 billion after it was previously rescinded. The ruling stems from a shareholder challenge in 2024.

items.title: Space Development Agency Awards Major Satellite Contracts; Blue Origin Conducts Groundbreaking Flight
items.summary: The U.S. Space Development Agency issued significant satellite awards, while Blue Origin achieved a groundbreaking flight test. NASA also called for an Artemis program review amid ongoing space developments.
